config._comment: errorComando, in case no command match

1.titulo: Got 15 minutes and want to learn Git?
tareas: Git allows groups of people to work on the same documents (often code) at the same time, and without stepping on each other's toes. It's a distributed version control system.
Our terminal prompt below is currently in a directory we decided to name 'octobox'. To initialize a Git repository here, type the following command:
errorMessages: fatal: Not a git repository (or any of the parent directories): .git
1.alert: Did not create a Git repo

tareas: Good job! As Git just told us, our 'octobox' directory now has an empty repository in /.git/. The repository is a hidden directory where Git operates.
To save your progress as you go through this tutorial -- and earn a badge when you successfully complete it -- head over to create a free Code School account. We'll wait for you here.
Next up, let's type the git status command to see what the current state of our project is:
errorMessages: fatal: Not a git repository (or any of the parent directories): .git
successMessages: nothing to commit (create/copy files and use 'git add' to track)
